description.narrative: The Project level outcome is the impact on farmers through: (i) adoption of sustainable coffee production practices and AAA sustainability standards; (ii) yield improvement; and (iii) domestic value addition through investments in processing facilities, leading to increased farm earnings through more reliable access to coffee markets including Nespresso. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that contribution to market creation will stem from better integrating underserved regions of the project countries into global value chains by setting up coffee buying points, processing facilities (wet/dry mills) close to the producers and demonstrating the business rationale for enhancing this type of physical infrastructure in the target areas to counter existing bottlenecks for revival of specialty coffee and sector development in general. The AS services contribute to demonstration effect largely at the production level through capacity building of farmers, motivating other sector players to establish or expand their engagement with smallholders to improve quality, increase coffee production, and to safeguard, revive and market rare and high quality coffee.

The Proposed Investment is a CHF 4 million equivalent corporate A Loan to the Nespresso Sustainability Innovation Fund (NSIF) to support Nespressos goal to further scale the farmer support provided through the AAA Sustainable Quality ProgramTM with a focus on the Reviving Origin program. At the same time, IFC will provide Advisory to support the implementation strategy in Uganda, Mozambique, and Zimbabwe. This Project will be IFCs second collaboration with Nespresso, after successfully establishing the proof of concept in Ethiopia and Kenya.
